Pre-Game Insights: Croatia and Italy meet to conclude their UEFA EURO 2024 Group B campaigns on Monday 24 June.
Coaches Zlatko Dalić and Luciano Spalletti both have plenty to ponder going into this pivotal Matchday 3 fixture.
Croatia have just a point so far after following up their defeat by Group B winners Spain with a 2-2 draw against Albania.
The Azzurri were also given a fright by Albania in their opening game – conceding inside 23 seconds – before recovering to win 2-1, though the holders had no answer to Spain next time out.
Possible line-ups for Croatia: Livaković; Stanišić, Šutalo, Pongračić, Gvardiol; Modrić, Brozović, Kovačić; Mario Pašalić, Kramarić, Sučić.
Possible line-ups for Italy: Donnarumma; Di Lorenzo, Bastoni, Calafiori, Dimarco; Cristante, Jorginho; Barella, Pellegrini, Chiesa; Retegui.
Croatia's form (all competitions, most recent first): DLWWWD.
Italy's form (all competitions, most recent first): LWWDWW.
Expert predictions: Elvir Islamović, Croatia reporter, noted that Croatia have got out of tougher situations and that Dalić will surely make several changes.
Expert predictions: Paolo Menicucci, Italy reporter, mentioned that Spalletti is expected to make some changes to his starting XI and will have to work on his players' heads.
Zlatko Dalić, Croatia coach, stated that Croatia have not started the tournament well and have been conceding goals too easily.
Luciano Spalletti, Italy coach, emphasized the need to gauge when to speed up the tempo of the game and when to calm down and control possession.
